Text: 'Joining the Kirov Ballet

My name is Nathalie. Last year, I was one of the youngest foreign students to join the Kirov ballet school in St Petersburg, Russia. At my first ballet class, I was nervous because I did not know anyone. Everyone came to me and asked questions in Russian. I tried to speak in Russian, and then they spoke in English, so we could talk. 

Now, six months later, everyone is very nice to me. My Russian is much better, and I understand my teachers. For the first two weeks, my mum stayed with me. When she left, I felt a little sad. I even called her at night because I felt lonely. 

The ballet classes in Russia are harder than in England. I eat a lot to have energy. This helps me do well in class. In the evenings, I watch my favorite movies on my computer, but sometimes I fall asleep before they finish. 

Now, I feel at home here. I like to walk around the city and visit the shops. In December, it was very cold! I bought a fur hat because it was minus 10 degrees Celsius, but the Russians said it was not very cold for that time. My room is warm and cozy. 

Right now, we are getting ready for a new show, and there is a competition for young dancers that I will enter. I feel very lucky to be here.'

**THE ICEHOTEL**

The Arctic is a cold place. In summer, many people visit to see the midnight sun. In winter, there are not many people. They have the snow and ice to themselves. 

In the late 1980s, people thought winter could be fun. In 1990, a French artist named Jannot Derit had an exhibition in a special igloo made of snow. This igloo was in a small town called Jukkasjarvi, by the frozen Torne River. Many visitors came to see it. 

One night, some guests decided to sleep in the igloo. The next morning, they were very happy. This gave them the idea to make an ice hotel. Now, the ICEHOTEL is famous all over the world. 

Every winter, a team of builders, architects, and artists come to Jukkasjarvi to build the hotel. They start building in December. Each week, a new part of the hotel opens until it is all finished on January 7th. The hotel is built outside, using snow and ice. Sometimes, the plan changes because of the weather. 

In spring, when it gets warm, the hotel melts. Inside the hotel, it is never colder than -5 to -8 degrees Celsius, even if it is very cold outside. Guests get warm clothes like overalls, hats, and gloves when they stay at the hotel. It is also good to bring sweaters, scarves, and thick socks. Guests should wear bigger shoes for thick socks. 

If you want to visit the hotel, you can buy warm clothes on the ICEHOTEL website. You can order them when you book your stay. The clothes will be in your room when you arrive. 

The ICEHOTEL is in Jukkasjarvi, 200 km above the Arctic Circle. It is 15 km from Kiruna airport and 17 km from Kiruna train station. You can take a bus from the airport or train station to the ICEHOTEL.

**Shopping for Furniture**

A report by Dave Worthington

Homestyle is a new furniture shop. It opened at midnight last Thursday. Many people came to the shop. About 6,000 people wanted to buy furniture. There were special offers. A leather sofa cost £45, but only until 3 am. A bed cost £30, but only from 3 am to 8 am. 

The shop usually opens from 9 am to 9 pm every day. But Homestyle said it would stay open for 24 hours. However, it had to close after only half an hour. 

A police officer said, "We knew many people would come, but they were not patient. The shop was full, so the managers decided to close the doors. The people outside got angry. They thought everything would be sold before they could go in. They did not want to wait in line. 

There was also a long line of cars trying to park. Many people left their cars in the road and walked to the shop. This blocked the road.

One customer, Jenny Smith, got into the shop. She said, "I waited in line for three hours, but I did not have time to buy what I wanted. The staff were calm and explained what was happening. It was not safe to stay open. I will come back when they open again, but I do not want to wait in line again."

**Membership**

The Short Story Society helps writers in Britain. It started in 1899 and is now a very active group for arts.

**Society Magazines**

We make good magazines, like the popular Short Story Review. This magazine has short stories from famous British writers and gives new writers a chance to share their work. Another magazine, Short Story News, has interviews with writers and information about events, competitions, and festivals. You can see some articles from recent issues on our website.

**National Short Story Competition**

We have the National Short Story Competition. It is the biggest competition for short stories. Anyone 18 years and older can enter. Stories can be about any topic and should be between 1,000 and 1,500 words long. Members of the Society do not pay to enter, but non-members pay £5. The competition is open from April to October each year. The ten best stories will be in our annual book. The winner will get a contract to publish their own book of short stories.

**Education**

For almost thirty years, the Society has helped writers in schools. We give children and teachers new ideas and help them feel good about their writing. One project is the Young Writer of the Year, which is for writers aged 11-18. Winners get book prizes and can join a five-day course with professional writers.

**The Writers' Cafe**

The Writers' Cafe is a nice place for members. It has good vegetarian food, coffee, and cold drinks. You can read our magazines there. The Cafe also has monthly exhibitions, short courses, and readings. It is in the center of London and is open from 11:00 am to 10:00 pm on weekdays and 11:00 am to 8:00 pm on Saturdays. Members get discounts on some products and events.

**Becoming a Member**

We have members all over the world. Anyone 18 years and older can join. If you want to join The Short Story Society, click here and fill out a form.

**Free-diving in the Caribbean**

Tanya Streeter is a free-diver. She has four world records. Free-diving is a sport where people dive deep into the ocean on one breath of air. In 2003, Tanya became the first person to dive 120 meters deep while holding her breath. She swam back up without help. A year before, she went deeper but used a balloon to come back up. This time, she held her breath for over three and a half minutes. She was the first woman to break a man’s world record in any sport.

A team of fourteen safety divers watched her dive. Some people think free-diving is too dangerous, but Tanya believes safety and training are very important. Most free-divers focus on one or two events, but Tanya trains the same way for all her events. She spends two-thirds of her training in the gym and the rest in the pool and ocean. She uses an exercise bike to make her heart strong. She does not run because she does not want to hurt her knees. Instead, she walks fast to stay fit.

When Tanya practices diving, she travels away from home. She tries to do fourteen dives in four weeks, with a rest day between each dive. It is important for her to not get tired, or it can ruin her training.

When she is not training, Tanya makes public appearances to promote sports products. She also helps environmental groups by doing research and making films. Tanya grew up on the Caribbean island of Grand Cayman. She loved swimming and exploring the sea life in rock pools. She says her life now is like her childhood dreams. Because she is famous in some countries, people listen to her talk about the environment.

Tanya is now in her thirties. She wants to keep breaking her own world records. She started free-diving when she was twenty-five, and she does not plan to stop for many years.

CARTOON FILMS

Cartoon films can be very fun. If you can draw, you can make your drawings move on the screen. New ideas and computer programs make cartoons exciting for everyone. 

In the late 1970s, many people thought cartoons were only for kids. But some directors had new ideas. They showed that both adults and kids can enjoy cartoons together. 

Not all cartoon films were good. For example, The Black Cauldron did not do well. It was too scary for kids and too silly for adults. Directors learned from this. Now, many cartoon films make a lot of money again.

New TV Star Caroline Benson talks about her first TV role. 

"I never thought I would spend my first year at university making a TV show called The Finnegans. I only acted in school, but I loved the book since I was eleven. My grandmother said I was like Polly Finnegan, and I always wanted to play her. 

I took a year off to travel before university. While I was in Chile, my mother emailed me. She said they wanted to make the book into a TV show. I knew I had to try for the part. My mother was surprised, but she sent my photo to the director and asked him to meet me. I flew back and got the part! 

Filming started a week after university began, so I asked for permission to be away for three weeks. When I returned to university, I woke up at 6:00 am to write my essays. I didn’t tell my friends, but they found out and thought it was great. It was an amazing experience, and I feel very lucky. 

After university, I want to be an actor. My family is not in acting, but my grandfather was an opera singer. I have tried for other TV roles, but I have not received any offers yet. I don’t know how I did it all because I also had a busy social life. 

When filming finished, I didn’t know what to do. I have acted in two college plays since then. I haven’t been home much, and now my first year at university is over. I am going to Greece for the summer with friends."

Text: 'No Title

I opened the first 'Body Shop' in 1976. I wanted to make enough money to feed my children. Now, 'The Body Shop' is a big company that is growing all over the world. I have learned a lot since we started. I want to share what I learned in this book. I believe we can run a successful business and still keep our values.

This book is not just about business or my life. The main idea is that to be successful, you need to be different. Business can be fun. A business can be run with love and can help people. In business and in life, I want to enjoy myself and feel like I am with family. I want my workers at 'The Body Shop' to feel the same way.

Now, this book shares my ideas with everyone. I believe there are no limits to our 'family' and what we can do. I find this thought exciting, and I hope you do too.'

**A Journey on the Beautiful Douro River**

Jules Verne has a 'hotel ship' on the Douro River in Portugal. The ship is called MV Lady Ivy May. It can take 160 guests. All rooms have a view, a private shower, and a toilet. The ship has air-conditioning. There is a sun-deck, lounge, bar, dining room, shop, and library.

**Itinerary**

**Day 1:** You will leave London Heathrow in the evening and go to Oporto. A guide will meet you and take you to the Lady Ivy May. You will sleep on the ship.

**Day 2:** In the morning, you will see Oporto. After that, you will return to the ship and go to Entre-os-Rios. This part of the trip takes four hours.

**Day 3:** You will keep traveling up the river. In the evening, the ship will stop at Peso da Regua, where they make port wine. You can try the local food and drink at dinner.

**Day 4:** After breakfast, you will take a bus to the old town of Lamego. You will visit the cathedral, some churches, and a museum. The museum used to be a palace and has many paintings, tapestries, and sculptures. Then, you will return to the ship and sail to Tua.

**Day 5:** The river becomes narrow here. If the water is deep enough, you may take a smaller boat to the Spanish border at Barca d'Alva. You will return to Tua by bus and see many things along the way.

**Day 6:** In the morning, you will drive to Sao Joao da Pesqueira for a great view of the Douro valley. You will return to the ship for lunch and then take a train ride through the countryside to Regua, where the Lady Ivy May will be waiting.

**Day 7:** You will visit Vila Real before returning to the ship for lunch. Then, you will go down the river to Oporto. You will sleep on the Lady Ivy May.

**Day 8:** You will arrive in Oporto with time to see the city and do some shopping before your flight back to London Heathrow.

HONEY

Honey is a sweet liquid made by bees. It is made of water and sugars. Bees can fly very far, up to seventy-five thousand kilometers, and visit over two million flowers to make just half a kilo of honey. The color and taste of honey depend on the flowers the bees visit. There are more than three hundred types of honey. Lighter honey usually tastes milder than darker honey.

A long time ago, honey was the main sweet food because sugar was hard to find. The ancient Egyptians valued honey a lot and used it as money. Today, people make and eat honey all over the world. Some studies say honey can help with tiredness and make athletes better. Honey is not just food; it can help with sore throats and is used in many skin and hair products.

**Norwich**

Norwich is the capital of East Anglia in Britain. It has been a place to live for more than 2,000 years. It started as a small village by the River Wensum. In 1066, when the Normans came, it was one of the biggest towns in England. 

Norwich has two cathedrals and a mosque. The first cathedral was built in 1095. It celebrated its 900th birthday recently. In 1994, Norwich celebrated 800 years of being a city. This meant it could govern itself.

Today, Norwich is smaller than London or Manchester. It has about 150,000 people. In the 16th century, it was the second city of England. For 300 years, it grew and became rich. It was famous for having many churches and pubs. Now, there are fewer churches and pubs.

In 1964, the University of East Anglia was built in Norwich. The city has many students and is a busy place for business. It has theatres, cinemas, nightclubs, cafes, restaurants, and arts centres. There is also a football team called 'The Canaries' with green and yellow colors.

One new place in Norwich is 'The Castle Mall', a shopping centre. For over two years, there was a big hole in the city while builders worked on it. They moved a lot of earth to make a park on the roof of the Mall, with water pools and trees. 

The people of Norwich are happy that the old market is still there, next to the new shopping centre. Both places are busy, showing that Norwich has a nice mix of old and new.

**The Albuquerque Balloon Festival**

Every autumn, the sky in Albuquerque, a city in the south-western United States, is full of bright colors. This is the Albuquerque Balloon Festival. It happens every year for nine days. The first festival was in 1972 to celebrate the 50th birthday of a local radio station. There were about twelve hot-air balloons that took off from a parking lot in Albuquerque. Since then, the festival has grown a lot. This year, at least a thousand balloons from many countries will come.

**What to See**

The pilots talk to each other on radios. They light up the burners of their balloons at the same time. This is called a "balloon glow." It is a great time to take pictures. You should come just after night falls or before 5:30 am to see the "glows" as the balloons go up into the dark sky. During the day, you can walk around the balloons and talk to the pilots as they get ready to fly. The balloons are in many sizes and colors. Some look like animals or cartoon characters, and some look like popular drinks and fast food. Kids will enjoy it!

In the afternoon, you can fly in a balloon over the desert with one of the many companies that offer rides. You can also take a cable car from the desert to the top of the nearby mountains. This is the longest cable car ride, and you can see the festival from above. There are many other fun things to do, like balloon races and fireworks on the first night and the last three nights of the festival.

**The Albuquerque Box**

This is a special wind pattern that helps balloon pilots. The Sandia Mountains protect the balloons from strong winds and create gentle winds at different heights. This helps pilots control where their balloons go.

**Practical Advice**

Buy your tickets online before the festival to avoid long lines. Wear several layers of thin clothes because it can be cool at night and in the morning, but during the day, you need sunglasses and sunscreen. Bring a flashlight for night events and don’t forget your camera. If you use film, make sure to get high-speed film for night pictures.

The Eden Project

The Eden Project is in the south-west of England. It is a very popular place for tourists. The big 'biospheres' look like something from a science fiction movie. Each biosphere has a different climate. They show how important plants are for people.

Many things we use every day come from plants. For example, we get wood, rubber, fruit, rice, sugar, coffee, and chocolate from plants. There are over 135,000 types of plants here.

Even if it is cold outside, the plants stay warm because of electric heaters. In the Rainforest Zone, it is always wet because of a big waterfall. There is also a zone that looks like the Mediterranean, California, and South Africa. Soon, they will build a desert zone too.

Some people have said they do not like this year's book, New Writing 3. I do not understand why. This book has 500 pages of good writing for £6.99. Most of the book is fiction, which means stories and parts of novels. There are nice stories by famous writers like Candia McWilliam and Rose Tremain. 

Some less famous writers write a lot about food. For example, Jane Harris wrote a story called Those Nails. Do not read it after you eat because it has some very bad scenes that might make you feel sick! 

There are also poems from nineteen poets, like R. S. Thomas and John Burnside. You can read parts of novels that are not finished by Jim Crace and Jane Rogers. There is a little non-fiction too. One funny article is by Alan Rusbridger about some newspapers. Ursula Owen wrote an amazing piece about herself. 

This is a great collection, and I am excited to see what next year's book will be like!

**Learning the Violin**

Margaret Porter is a violin teacher. She says the best age to start learning the violin is between three and six years old. This is when children learn a lot about the world. Margaret lives in London. She likes to teach children who are three or four years old, but she also teaches some five-year-olds who really want to learn.

Margaret started teaching the violin in 1972. Her first class had her children’s friends who were five years old. In her classes, students learn in groups. Each group has about twelve students. They have lessons for one hour, every two weeks. Each student also has one lesson alone with Margaret every week. 

Parents must come to the lessons too. It is important for parents to be interested in the lessons. In the beginning, students learn to play music by listening. They do not read music for a long time. At first, their playing and reading music are very different. 

Margaret says her way of teaching is not to make great violinists. If a student plays very well, she suggests they learn with other methods.

**Moonshine**

The band Moonshine has a new CD. It is called "Here Again." This is their third CD. It comes after their last CD, "The Waves." 

There are some changes in the band. Tom Wilcott plays the bass guitar now. He replaces Simon McVee, who left the band last year. Tom Simpson is the new drummer. 

The first song on the CD is a dance song. The band is not making slow songs anymore. The second song is also a dance song and is very loud. Many fans will be surprised by these songs. They are very good and could be popular.

The singer, Rob Letchford, sings very well. He can reach all the notes. Fans are happy he recorded the songs before he had problems with his throat. Because of this, the band had to cancel their next tour. If you bought tickets, do not worry. The concerts will be rescheduled when Rob feels better.

On this CD, Moonshine shows they can make great music in different styles. They have slow songs and dance songs. I think the best songs are at the beginning, and the last songs are not as good. 

"Here Again" will be a big hit and help the band become more successful.

San Francisco

San Francisco is a city on the coast of northern California. The first Europeans to see this area were led by a Spanish explorer named Gaspar de Portola. He saw it for the first time in 1769. San Francisco Bay is a beautiful place, but it was found by land, not by sea.

In 1849, many people came to San Francisco to look for gold. But the people who got rich were not the gold seekers. The rich people owned banks and law firms. They built big houses on a hill called Nob Hill.

Today, many tourists visit San Francisco. They want to see famous places like Chinatown and the Golden Gate Bridge. Some people even take a short boat trip to Alcatraz Island to see the old prison.

SAMUEL PEPYS

Samuel Pepys wrote a famous diary in English. His diary talks about life in England from 1660 to 1669. Pepys writes about important events, like sickness, a navy coming up the River Thames, and the Great Fire of London. He also writes about his own life. He shares his mistakes, like sleeping in church and looking at pretty girls. 

Pepys talks about his home life, too. He had fights with his wife but they made up. He worried when she was sick. He liked music, the theatre, card games, and parties with good food and fun. 

Pepys was a busy man with many important jobs. He was a Member of Parliament and the President of the Royal Society. He is also known for his work with the British Navy.

**The History of Shoes**

A long time ago, shoes were not very comfortable or stylish. People used animal skins to cover their feet. They tied these skins around their ankles when it was cold. 

Today, we still use leather for shoes, but we also use other materials like silk, plastic, and cotton. This depends on what is popular at the time. 

About 150 years ago, people started to wear different shoes for each foot. Before that, shoes were the same shape and could be worn on either foot. 

In the past, all shoes were made by hand. Now, many shoes are made by machines in big factories. Sewing machines help make many shoes quickly and at a lower price.

When I hurt my back, I had to stop running for a while. I wanted to help more women enjoy running. I started a running club for women in my area. I was upset because many race organizers say there are not enough women in running, but they do not make good places for women to change. 

I made posters, and 40 women joined my club. They were young and old, fit and not fit. They wanted to lose weight, but many had not thought about running before. They thought running was hard and painful. They did not think about having fun, talking, and smiling while running in nice places, like by a river.

At first, they could only run for one minute. Now, they can run for thirty minutes! They also learned about healthy food and staying fit. I wanted to help women with running, and I am very happy to see how much they have improved. They are happy too!

**THE HISTORY OF THE IDITAROD - THE LAST GREAT RACE ON EARTH**

In the 1880s, people found gold in Alaska, the northernmost state of the USA. Many people came to Alaska to find gold and get rich. New towns were built quickly. One town was called Iditarod, which means "far, distant place." In 1909, Iditarod became the largest city in Alaska for a short time.

In summer, boats brought supplies to the towns. But in winter, rivers and the ocean froze, and boats could not come. So, in 1910, a winter path was made for dog teams pulling sleds. They took mail, food, and clothes to the gold miners. This path was called the Iditarod Trail. It took about three weeks for a team of dogs to travel across Alaska. They stopped at "roadhouses" to sleep and eat.

The trail was used every winter until the 1920s when airplanes became the main way to travel. But in 1925, there was a big problem. A disease called diphtheria was in the city of Nome. The medicine was far away in Anchorage. Airplanes were new, and no one knew if they could fly in the cold. So, they decided to use dog teams to bring the medicine.

The trip was over 1,000 kilometers long, mostly on the Iditarod Trail. It took twenty dog teams just six days to finish. Leonhard Seppala, a Norwegian man looking for gold, traveled the first 400 kilometers with his dog Togo. Togo was very good at finding the way in the snow.

The last part of the trip was done by Gunnar Kaasen, who had driven dog teams for 21 years. His lead dog was Saito. At one point, Balto, another dog, stopped the team from falling into icy water. They got the medicine to Nome, and Balto became a hero.

Now, every year, there is a dog sled race from Anchorage to Nome. This race follows the famous route from 1925. It is called the Iditarod and is known as "The Last Great Race on Earth."

**Sweden's Ice Hotel**

The village of Jukkasjarvi is in Sweden. In winter, it can be very cold, up to -40 degrees Celsius. Many people visit this place every year. They come to see a special hotel made of ice. 

In this hotel, you can eat, drink, and sleep in ice rooms. You can even have a wedding there! The bar is made of ice too, so you should not put hot drinks on it. The bedrooms are about -4 degrees Celsius. But don’t worry! Guests get special sleeping bags to keep warm. You can also get warm clothes if you need them.

The hotel is only open for six months. In summer, it melts. Every winter, workers build it again. They use 10,000 tonnes of ice and 30,000 tonnes of snow to make the hotel.

Maria Mutola

In 1988, Maria Mutola played football. She was the only girl on a boys' team in Mozambique. "We won," she said. "At first, no one cared that I was a girl. But then the other team got upset."

A man named Jose Craveirinha read about Maria in a newspaper. He helped many African athletes. He went to see Maria and found her playing football. He saw that she was very fast. "He talked to me about running," Maria said. "I did not understand. I only knew about football. Then he bought me running shoes and took me to train. It was hard work, and my legs hurt."

Jose spoke to Maria's parents. He told them she could be successful and help the family. They agreed to let him take her to train. In 1991, Maria went to train in the United States. She was scared to go because she would miss her family.

In the US, Maria met other girls who were good at sports. But their lives were different. "They worried about clothes and make-up," she said. "I worried about my family having enough food. They did not know my problems. But I was happy to be there. The trainers were great, and I learned a lot."

Today, Maria still runs. She lives in South Africa with her mother for most of the year.

The Skywalk

The Grand Canyon is in the United States. It was made by the Colorado River. Many people visit the Grand Canyon Park to walk, run, and see the view. The view is very beautiful, and the Skywalk makes it even better. 

The Skywalk is 1219 meters above the bottom of the Grand Canyon. It is a platform made of glass. You can see the pretty rocks below you. Up to 120 people can stand on the Skywalk at the same time. It opened in 2007, and many people have used it since then. 

You must wear special covers on your shoes to protect the glass. Walking on the Skywalk feels like flying high in the air.

THE ROCKIES

The Rocky Mountains are in North America. They start in the North-west and go down south. The Rockies are not as high as the Alps, but they are very beautiful. There are many roads in the Rockies, but the best way to see them is by train. 

You can start your trip in Vancouver. Vancouver is a nice city in Canada. You can see water and mountains there. People can ski just 15 minutes from the city. 

Before, thirty trains left Vancouver every day to go across the country. Now, there are only three trains a week. But the train ride is still very exciting. You can sleep on the train, which is fun, but you see the beautiful views at night.

**ZOOS**

People have kept animals in zoos for over 3,000 years. A long time ago, the rulers of China made a big zoo called the Gardens of Intelligence. In early zoos, animals did tricks for visitors. Now, this does not happen. Today, zoos are places where people can see animals acting naturally.

Most cities have a zoo or a wildlife park. Some people think zoos are good. They say zoos help us learn about nature and see wild animals up close. 

But not everyone likes zoos. Some people think it is wrong to keep animals in cages. They say that in bad zoos, animals live in dirty places and do not get good food.

**JAZZ**  
By Katie Atkins, age 14  

I play the trumpet in my school jazz band. Last month, we had a jazz competition with bands from other high schools, and our band won! Each band wore different costumes. My band wore black school uniforms, and other bands wore bright T-shirts. We did not look like professional adult bands, but we played very well. Everyone was young, but we were used to performing. 

Each band made new songs on stage. It was fun to watch, but it was even better when my band played! My school has a great jazz band, but not everyone can join. Only about half of the people who want to play can be in the band. But anyone who wants to play can go to jazz practice before school. We also spend time together after school, listening to jazz and learning about it. 

We go on trips to jazz summer camps in the country. I have been to a few and learned a lot. Adults are often surprised that young people like jazz. My music teacher thinks it is because pop music is not hard enough for serious music lovers like me. I find jazz exciting because it is both new and old. You can make your own music, but you also feel part of its history when you play on stage like great jazz musicians did before. 

My school is lucky because we have great teachers and parents who help us. Without them, we could not do well with our music!

**Watering the Desert**

In Marrakesh, Morocco, it can rain from November to March. It does not rain often. When it rains, the water pipes cannot hold all the water, and the streets become like rivers. Many winters have been dry, so when it rains, the people are happy.

Marrakesh has parks and gardens, but they do not get water from rain. They get water from underground channels. These channels were made a long time ago, in the 11th century. They bring water from the mountains all year.

Places that are mostly dry and get water this way are called oases. 

If you go south from Marrakesh, you will find Skoura. In Skoura, people use all the land to grow food. There are small squares of land with water channels. The Atlas mountains, which have snow in winter, look beautiful in the background.

**Gareth Ellis**

Gareth Ellis is 13 years old. He is the youngest son of Alan and Kath. Alan is an engineer, and Kath is a nursery teacher. Gareth has two older brothers who work in banking and computers. But Gareth wants to be a clown.

Three years ago, Gareth and his parents joined a circus. Kath says, "People laugh when we tell them, but it is true. Gareth wanted to be a clown since he was three years old." When Alan lost his job, he and Kath looked for jobs in the circus. They both got jobs, and Gareth started to train to be a clown. He calls himself Bippo.

In the summer, they travel with the circus. In the winter, they go home. Gareth's brothers can take care of the house while they are away. Kath says, "It was not easy. We had to think about many things. We only had a small car and a tiny caravan to sleep in. We left our nice house. The only thing Gareth missed was his long baths."

Gareth says, "People ask about my school. But wherever we go, someone teaches me. I use the same books as my friends at school, and I have a computer. I have not fallen behind." 

About the future, Kath says, "It was a hard choice, but this is the best way to teach Gareth about being a clown. I am happy, and we enjoy it." 

Gareth says, "One day, I will be the main clown in a circus, maybe Bippo's circus."

**Eight-eighteen News**

Eight-eighteen News is a news group for young people. The members are between 8 and 18 years old. We collect news and write stories. We send these stories to newspapers, magazines, TV, radio, and websites. You can read or listen to the news stories on the Eight-eighteen website.

We have three places in the country where young people can meet and work on projects. We want to open more places soon. Since we started in 1994, over 2,500 young people have joined us. Sophie is one of them. She says: "I first heard about Eight-eighteen when they asked me about young people's thoughts on hip hop music. I met young journalists and saw the great things they did. Age did not matter; they could write their own stories. I went to the Eight-eighteen center in my city, got training, and was a member until I was 18. Eight-eighteen helped me do more than I thought I could. I learned many skills and got a job at 19. Now, I check articles for a big news website."

**Join Us!**

When you join Eight-eighteen, you will get training and go to meetings every month. In these meetings, we decide who will write each news story. Members help each other learn. Older members, called "peer trainers," teach new members basic journalism skills. Some of these trainers present to groups of young people and adults outside of Eight-eighteen, like in youth clubs and summer camps. They always have support from older staff.

Eight-eighteen News has training for new members three times a year. The next training will be in February. If you or someone you know wants to join, call Director Den Ley at 01622 657874 for more information. The Eight-eighteen program is good for children with all reading and writing skills. Membership is free, and you do not need to take a test to join.

**Antarctica Sightseeing Flights Website**

Welcome to our website! Here is what you need to know before booking a flight.

In the summer, we take tourists on a big plane (Boeing 747) from Sydney, Australia, to see Antarctica and then back. The flight dates for next year are not ready yet, but if you book now, you can change your date if needed.

**Questions**

Here are answers to common questions about our flights.

**How long is the flight?**  
The flight is about 12 hours. After about 4 hours, we see sea ice and icebergs. We spend 4 hours over Antarctica and then fly back home. During the flight, experts talk about Antarctica and answer questions. There is a camera next to the pilot so you can see what the pilot sees from take-off to landing.

**Will I get a seat next to a window?**  
All passengers get two boarding passes. Halfway through the flight, you will move to the seat on your second pass. Business and first-class passengers will have a window seat for half of the flight and a seat next to a window for the other half. Economy passengers will have a window seat or a seat next to a window for half of the flight and a seat at the end of the row for the other half. While we are over Antarctica, you can get up and walk around the plane to see the sights. The pilot flies in big circles so everyone can see well from both sides of the plane.

**What happens if the weather is bad?**  
We have 17 different flight plans. The captain checks the weather on the morning of the flight and chooses the best way to see the views.

**Will I see penguins and other wildlife?**  
Most wildlife is far below the plane, so we cannot see them well. We do not land in Antarctica because it is better for the environment. If you want to see wildlife, you need to go on a boat tour.

**Can I take photographs?**  
Yes! You can bring all cameras. We also have fun photo opportunities on the plane where you can wear cold weather clothes from Antarctica.

**Little Chefs**

Some children, aged ten to fifteen, spend their Saturdays learning to cook. Many kids want to join, so there is a waiting list of 30 children. Parents pay £280 for the course. The children have fun and learn to make good food.

Bill is ten years old. He says, "I love my mum's cooking, and now I can cook better than her. The teachers make us laugh, especially when we eat the food we made."

Flora is twelve. She has trouble with onions. She says, "I love cooking. I made a meal for ten friends, and they liked it. My mum told me to find a hobby for the weekends. I liked staying at home, so I was not sure at first. But now I am very happy I came."

Their teacher, Philippe, says, "It is great fun. Children pay attention and remember better than adults, but the kitchen can be messy when they cook! Adults keep learning about food. If parents teach their children to cook when they are young, the children will know how to make food for themselves when they grow up."

**Winter Driving**

Winter can be dangerous for driving. It is hard to know what will happen, and accidents can happen easily. Fog can be on the road, and ice can be under the snow. A car coming towards you might slide on the road.

**Rule Number One:** Drive smoothly. If you move the car too fast or too suddenly, it can be hard to control. When you turn the wheel, press the brakes, or go faster, do it gently and slowly. Think about driving with a full cup of hot coffee next to you. Drive carefully so you do not spill it.

**Rule Number Two:** Pay attention to the road. Look far ahead, especially if there is ice. Test how long it takes to stop by pressing the brakes gently. You might be going faster than you think. 

When the road is wet, stop twice as far away as normal. On snow, stop three times as far. On ice, stop even further. Always try to keep control of your car to stay safe.

Craigie Aitchison

Craigie Aitchison is a painter from Scotland. He moved to London to study law, but he went to art school instead. In art school, he found drawing hard, but he kept painting. When he was in his late twenties, the Italian government gave him money to study art. He became interested in old Italian artists, and this can be seen in some of his paintings. He loved the green and brown colors of the Italian fields and the bright light there. He wanted to show this light in his paintings. 

Aitchison paints colors in thin layers, from light to dark. He says he does not know what the final painting will look like. He explains, "It's a secret - because I don't know myself." He does not start with a plan for the colors. He believes anyone can use colors because you can buy them. He just pays attention to how colors look next to each other.

Unlike some artists, Aitchison does not make drawings before he paints. He thinks that if he draws first, he might get bored and not finish the painting. He changes his paintings many times before they are done. He likes to paint people who do not want to see their pictures while he is painting. He says, "If I feel they're worried and want to look at the painting, I can't do it."

Since he moved to London, Aitchison does not feel part of the Scottish art scene. He is not interested in following old traditions. He just paints in his own way. Still, his work inspires young British painters.

**Rock Band**

Two years ago, our son Ben, who is 14 years old, asked us for drums for his birthday. At first, we did not want to buy them because of the noise. Ben said, "It is better than watching TV or playing video games. It will keep me out of trouble." In the end, we agreed. We said, "Okay, but you must think about the family and the neighbors when you play."

This was just the start. The other boys in Ben's band came to our house with their guitars and other music things. Now, for many hours each week, our house is loud with their music and singing. 

When the band practices, my husband and I go for a long walk. I must say, even if their music is a little strange, they are nice and polite boys. I cannot say if they are good musicians, but they play at local clubs for young people.

We worry that they will not do enough school work because of the band, but this has not happened yet. I always tell Ben that his studies are very important. But one thing is sure: Ben was right. Playing music has kept him out of trouble, and he is never bored.

**Atlantic College**

Last week, I visited Atlantic College. It is a good private college in Wales. The college helps young people learn about life outside the classroom and study for their exams.

The students are between 16 and 18 years old. They come from many countries. In the morning, they study. In the afternoon, they do helpful activities. They might help on a farm, care for people with learning difficulties, or check rivers for pollution.

Atlantic College has students from different backgrounds. Many students cannot pay the fees of £20,000 for two years, so there are grants to help them. About 25% of the students are British, and many get help from the government to attend.

Barbara Molenkamp, a student from the Netherlands, said, "I admire the college for helping young people understand each other. You learn to live with people and respect them, even if you do not like them. During the summer, my mother saw that I argued less with my sister."

In short, Atlantic College gives students a great education with methods that work well.

Text: 'Being an older student

I am 32 years old. I just finished my first year at university. I go to classes and I have to read books quickly and write long papers. I decided to go to university after being away from school for fourteen years. I worked as a secretary. I earned good money, but I was bored. I did not have to think much at my job. I felt sad because I thought I was stuck in that job. I saw students at the local university. They looked happy and full of hope. I wanted to feel that way too.

Now that I am a student, I find it hard to make friends with younger students. They often think I am a teacher and ask me questions I cannot answer. I also feel different from the teachers. Even though we are the same age, I know less than they do. But I am happy to study because I know I need a degree to get a good job. This is very important to me. 

I like to spend my weekends reading instead of going to parties, which is different from most eighteen-year-olds. I also enjoy the student benefits like long holidays and discounts for the theatre and cinema. Sometimes I worry about what I will do after university, but I hope that going back to school now is a good choice.'

**Henry Ford**

Henry Ford was born on a farm in Michigan in 1863. He did not like farming. When he was fifteen years old, he started to work as a mechanic. In 1893, he made his first car. After he drove it for 1,500 kilometers, he sold it and made two bigger cars. In 1903, he started the Ford Motor Company. He used strong and light steel to make cars that were cheap for regular people to buy. 

In 1908, he made the first Ford Model 'T'. It cost $825. Soon, he was selling 100 cars every day. By 1927, the Ford Motor Company was worth $700 million. Early Ford cars were simple and cheap, but this meant people had less choice. Henry Ford said about the Model T, "You can have any color you like, as long as it is black."

**Rebecca Stevens**

Rebecca Stevens was the first woman to climb Mount Everest. Before climbing the mountain, she was a journalist and lived in a small flat in south London. In 1993, Rebecca left her job and family. She traveled to Asia with other climbers.

Life on Everest is hard. Rebecca said, "You must carry everything on your back. You can only take what you need. You can't wash on the mountain. I didn't even take a toothbrush. There is no water, only snow. Water is heavy, so you only take enough to drink!"

On May 17, 1993, Rebecca reached the top of Mount Everest. It was the best moment of her life. After that, she became famous. Now, she has written a book about her trip, and people often ask her to talk about it. She also has a new job on a science program on television.

Rebecca is well known today. She has more money, but she still lives in her small flat in south London with her pictures and books about mountains!

Dear Mike, 

I am sorry you could not come to my party yesterday. Jon told me you were sick and stayed in bed. Are you feeling better now? The party was very good! Many of my friends were there and they gave me nice presents. I will tell you more about the party when you come to school on Monday. 

Love, Lorenzo

**CANADA GEESE**

Canada Geese are big birds that are blue and white. When autumn comes, they fly south to find warmer weather. It is very cold in Canada in winter, and the birds can die if they stay there.

Last spring, a man named Bill Lishman found sixteen young Canada Geese on his farm. The young birds had lost their parents. Bill thought, "These young birds will not know what to do in autumn." 

Bill had a small plane. He decided to teach the birds to follow him. All summer, he flew his plane, and the young geese followed him. 

When autumn came and it got cold, Bill flew to Virginia in the United States. Virginia is 600 miles south of Canada. The geese followed him all the way. Bill left the geese in Virginia and went back home.

This spring, Bill waited for the geese to come back. They did not come, so he flew to Virginia to find them. He looked for two weeks but could not find them. 

When Bill got back home, he found the geese waiting for him. They had found their way home by themselves!

ESTHER'S STORY

Esther left school when she was sixteen years old. Her aunt Flory gave her £500 for her birthday. Most of Esther's friends went to college, but Esther used the money to start her own business. She bought fruit, sugar, and glass jars to make jam. She sold the jam for £1 a jar to her friends and soon had £1,000.

At first, her parents did not want her to make jam. They wanted her to study and become a teacher or a doctor. But Esther did not listen. She kept making jam. After a few months, she sold her jam at the local market. Then she started making orange juice and sold it to a school where her friend worked.

After two years, her business grew a lot. Her parents were very happy with her. She made many kinds of food and sold them to shops and supermarkets. She was so busy that she needed to hire some people to help her.

**Corryvale Farm**

Corryvale Farm is in the west of England. Stephen and Jenny Blackler have cows and chickens. They sell milk and eggs. But most of their money comes from Jenny's sheep. She has 50 sheep. Each sheep has enough wool for six sweaters. Every six months, Stephen cuts the wool off the sheep. This helps the sheep not to get too warm.

Five years ago, Jenny made sweaters with the wool. She tried to sell them at country markets. But it was summer and hot, so people did not want to buy sweaters. Then, she made socks. Everyone loved the socks because they were cheap, strong, and easy to wash. This is how Jenny's business started.

At first, Jenny made the socks at home. Soon, she had many customers. So, she sent the wool to a factory. Now, all the socks are made by machines. There are six colors and five sizes for all ages. There are also different socks for walkers, sportsmen, and skiers.

Jenny is very busy at Christmas because Corryvale socks are a popular gift. In her office, there are many letters from happy customers from all over the world.

**BURGLARS LIKE THE AFTERNOON**

Most house burglaries happen between 2 p.m. and 6 p.m., say the police. Inspector Ian Saunders told us that house burglaries have gone up by more than 30% compared to last year. He said that 67% of burglaries happen when people go out and forget to close a door or a window. 

Night-time burglaries are not common because families are usually at home then. But in winter, afternoons are good for burglars because it is dark and they can hide easily. Many houses are empty at this time because people are still at work.

Inspector Saunders said it is a good idea to leave lights on in living rooms and bedrooms when you go on holiday. This can help keep burglars away. He also asked neighbors to watch other houses when people are not home. They should call the police if they see something strange. 

"We will also tell you how to make your house safe," Inspector Saunders said. "This help costs nothing."

**The History of Farming**

Before farming, people looked for plants and fruit in the forest to eat. They moved around a lot to find food. About 12,000 years ago, in the Middle East, people started to grow food. These people were the first farmers. 

Farming helped people stay in one place. Their villages became bigger. Some people in the villages could do other jobs, like making clothes, because farmers grew food for everyone. 

But farming was hard when the weather was bad. Sometimes, people did not have enough food to eat. 

Today, farmers can grow more food. The food travels a long way to reach our homes.

**WORKING FOR AN AIRLINE**

Nicola Peet finished school when she was eighteen. Then, she went to college and worked at a local airport. After nine months, she started working for Saudi Arabian Airlines. Later, she became an air hostess for British Airways. Four years later, she became a manager.

Nicola said, "My office is at Heathrow Airport, but I spend 60% of my time in the air. I teach air hostesses and help them with problems. I also go to many meetings. I usually work from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., but sometimes I work from 1 p.m. to 9 p.m. 

At work, I first check plane times on my computer. Then, I talk with some air hostesses. Sometimes, I go on long flights to see how the air hostesses are doing. This is my favorite part of the job, but I like office work too. 

Travelling can be hard. When I come back from a long trip, I just want to eat and go to bed! I don’t earn a lot of money, but I am happy with British Airways. I want to stay there and keep traveling."

The Weather People care about the weather for many reasons. The weather is important for many jobs. For example, farmers need to know about the weather. Many years ago, farmers looked at the sky, animals, and flowers to understand the weather. Now, we have computers that help us learn about the weather. People can also get weather information on their mobile phones. 

Today, many people still believe old ideas about the weather. They say if the sky is red in the evening, it will be sunny the next day. Some people think that if cows lie down in the fields, it will rain soon.

Frazer and Peter are 14-year-old boys. They live in a small town in Canada. They are good friends and go to the same school. They like to fish and swim on weekends. But for the last few months, they have been in Peter's room every weekend. They are not doing homework. They are making a new computer word game.

The idea for the game came from Frazer's little brother, Kevin. Kevin has trouble reading. He learns better with pictures and sounds. Frazer wanted to help his brother. So, Frazer and Peter worked together for over 200 hours to make the game. Now, it is ready to use.

The game has pictures and sounds. For example, when you see the word "hat," there is a picture of a hat, and you can hear Peter say, "Hat! Hat!" Frazer and Peter have won many prizes for their game. Soon, it will be sold all over the world. Many schools want to buy it.

HOW DOES THE IRISH POP GROUP 'BOYZONE' LIVE A HEALTHY LIFE?

Sleeping well is very important. When I go home to my mother's house, I sleep for ten hours. But after a concert, I find it hard to sleep because my head is full of music.

Sport is also important. Before my car accident, I went to the sports center for two and a half hours every day, five days a week. Now, I cannot do that, so I do about 150 sit-ups every day. I do not drink alcohol or smoke. I try to eat healthy food. I drink a lot of water because it is good for health. I should drink about eight glasses a day, but I do not always drink that much.

People should not work all the time. I love my job, but I also like to do other things. In my free time, I listen to music or watch TV. It is good to relax sometimes. I do not feel tired anymore since the doctor told me to eat better. Now, I eat many healthy foods like carrots and spinach every day. But I still eat burgers sometimes!

**Bollywood**

Bollywood is the name of the film industry in Mumbai, India. It makes almost 1,000 films every year. Since its first film in 1913, Bollywood has made over 29,000 films. This is more than the USA, so it is the biggest film industry in the world. 

Many Indians like to watch films. Ten million people go to the cinema every day. Bollywood films often tell love stories, and there is a lot of singing and dancing in them. People outside India also enjoy Indian films. Last year, Bollywood made over $500 million by selling its films to other countries.

Indian actors make more films each year than American actors in Hollywood, but they earn less money. This is why most Bollywood films cost about $2 million to make. A Hollywood film usually costs more than $5 million.

Most Bollywood actors are young. They work hard but only for a few years. Amitabh Bachchan is a famous actor in India. He has been in more than 140 films and has acted for almost 40 years.

Bill Bryson

I was born in the United States. I have written many travel books about England. I lived in England with my wife and four children for 20 years. Now, we have lived in the United States for three years. Our children are learning about life in the United States. I think they will be happy because they have lived in two countries.

I like Britain and want to go back, but my daughter, Felicity, will start college here soon. So, I will not go back for four years. I just went to England for six weeks. I worked on a radio show about the English language and talked about my new book.

Most writers do not like to travel and sell their books. I do not mind it. I like to visit new places and meet new people. It is very different from my life in the United States when I write. In England, people drove me in big cars and I stayed in nice hotels. It was good because I did not have to pay for anything. Everyone was nice to me and it was fun.

Schnauzer Dogs

There are three sizes of Schnauzer dogs. The two smaller sizes came to England more than 50 years ago. The Giant Schnauzer is newer in England. The Giant Schnauzer is big. It is 65 to 67.5 cm tall. All Schnauzers have long hair, and they need haircuts often. Most smaller Schnauzers are grey, but the Giant Schnauzer is usually black. 

Schnauzers come from Germany. Farmers use them to help with sheep. The police also use Schnauzers because they are very smart. Schnauzers are good family dogs. They are friendly and great with young children.

The Ruwenzori Mountains

Mary Daniels is a student in England. This year, she had a very interesting summer holiday. She traveled with fifteen other people to the Ruwenzori Mountains in Africa. They went there to help make a road through a forest between two big towns.

Mary said, "It was very difficult because there was no water to drink and no shops to buy food." It was also very cold and wet in the mountains. The Ruwenzori Mountains are one of the wettest places in the world.

Mary stayed in the mountains for six weeks. It was hard work, but she says it was the best thing she has ever done. She hopes to go back next year to help again.

**The Long Night**  
This is David Reilly's first book. David was a teacher before he became a writer. Maha is a nurse in northern Australia. She works in a small hospital. One day, a baby is very sick. Maha has to drive all night to take the baby to a big city. They have many problems on the way.

**Hard Work**  
This is Joanna Jones's twentieth book. Hard Work is about Sombat. He works with his father, who is a carpenter, in Thailand. They make tables and chairs, but they do not have money. One day, a man in black buys the most beautiful table in the shop.

**Hospital or Cinema?**  
Marcie Jacome wrote this story. She studies English in London. Tina is a young woman from Brazil. She wants to be a doctor. She goes to London to study English and medicine. One day, a man asks her to go to the USA to be a film star. What will Tina choose?

**The History of Horse Racing**

Horse racing is an important sport. It started a long time ago, about 4,500 years ago, in Central Asia. People in Greece and Rome liked horse racing too. 

Modern horse racing began in Europe in the 12th century when Arab horses came to Europe. At first, there were only two horses in a race, and the races were long. But in the 18th century, races became shorter and had many horses running together.

Today, many people watch horse racing in the USA. It is the second most popular sport after baseball. Horse racing is also popular in other parts of the world.

Nick Barlow is a world traveler. He is a British actor. He travels to many countries to make TV shows. "People are nice to me everywhere," he says. "When I go home, I remember all the good things from each country." 

Nick has been to many places, but he wants to visit South America and go back to Australia one day. He travels with a team. They bring cameras and other things to make the show. Nick does not take many things for himself. He takes a few shirts and pants, but he always brings books in his suitcase.

Nick's wife, Helen, is okay with him traveling for work. She has many friends and stays busy. When Nick comes home, she likes to hear his travel stories. 

Sometimes, there are problems. When Nick was in the Malaysian rain forest, he heard that Helen was sick in the hospital. "I felt very bad because I could not help her, but she did not want me to come home. I was very happy when I heard she was better."

**Parrots**

Parrots are beautiful birds. They have nice colors and long tails. You can see them in forests or zoos. Parrots live in countries like Brazil, Australia, and India. They like to live in big groups. Parrots eat a lot of fruit, so they can be a problem for farmers.

There are many types of parrots. All parrots have strong beaks and feet. They use their beaks and feet to climb and hold food. Some parrots can live for 80 years. They are very noisy, but they are smart. You can teach them to talk. Some zoos have shows with parrots. You can watch the parrots do tricks they have learned.

HOWARD BONNIER

Bray is a pretty village about fifty kilometers west of London. A young man named Howard Bonnier opened a restaurant called The Palace there three and a half months ago. Not many people in Britain know his name yet, but he is already famous in France. He has written about many good restaurants in French magazines. He is 29 years old.

When Howard was a teenager, he often went to restaurants with his parents. He liked this a lot, so he did not buy many clothes or CDs. Instead, he used his money to go to France and eat in good restaurants. He also has many cookbooks. He says he has more than two hundred and fifty!

Why did he open a restaurant? He loves cooking. Is it easy? He says it is expensive to start a restaurant. It is also harder to cook for fifty people than for his family. But he believes he made the right choice.

John Pickering

In a small park in England, John Pickering cuts the grass and waters the flowers. Last week, he was in Tokyo. Many people in Japan watched him on TV because he is a famous singer there. John is 35 years old.

A few months ago, John sang in dance clubs in Osaka and Nagoya, Japan. A radio DJ heard his songs and played them on his show. Many young people called the radio to ask for his songs again. In Japan, John uses the name Jon Otis when he sings.

John will still work in the park in England. He does not know how much money he will make from singing. He says, "I must keep my job in the park. I still have to pay my bills!" The other gardeners do not know he is famous in Japan. They have never heard him sing.

John's wife, Denise, works in a hospital. She says, "This will not change how we live. I only know John Pickering, not Jon Otis!"

**Line Dancing**

Many people in Britain have a new hobby called line dancing. You can find clubs and classes for line dancing in almost every town. 

Line dancing is easy to learn. If you can walk, you can do it! Fiona Lever, a teacher, says, "You don’t need a partner because you dance in groups. It is a great way to make new friends." In her classes, there are both young and old people. The boys like it because they can make a lot of noise with their feet when they dance!

When did line dancing start? Most people think it began about fifteen years ago when American country music became popular in Britain.

The Rhino

There are five types of rhinos in the world. The Black and White rhinos live in Africa. The other types live in forests in Asia. Rhinos are big and heavy. Their skin is hard and they have little hair. Rhinos have four short legs. Each foot has three toes. They walk slowly, but they can run fast, up to 50 kilometers an hour. Rhinos are usually quiet and calm. They eat grass and plants. A baby rhino weighs 40 kilos when it is born. It stays in its mother for about fifteen months. An adult rhino weighs more than 200 kilos and can live for 50 years.

**THE HISTORY OF THE LONDON POLICE**

A long time ago, in 1700, there were no policemen in London. Only a few old men walked the streets at night to help keep people safe, but they did not get paid much. 

As London grew bigger, it became very dirty, and many people were poor. There were many thieves who stole money, so people stayed at home to be safe. 

In 1750, a man named Henry Fielding paid some people to stop the thieves. They were called the 'Bow Street Runners' because they worked near Bow Street. After 50 years, there were 120 Bow Street Runners, but London was still very big and needed more help. 

In 1829, the first London Police Force started with 3,000 officers. Most of them walked, but some rode horses. Until 1920, all the police officers in London were men. 

Today, London police officers earn good money, and the few who ride horses earn even more.

Text: 'Visit the Edinburgh Festival! Every year, many people go to Edinburgh, the capital city of Scotland, for the Edinburgh Festival. This festival happens for three weeks in August and September. The city is full of actors and artists from many countries. They come to Edinburgh for the biggest arts festival in Britain. During this time, the streets are full of music and dance from morning to night. You can see artists painting pictures on the streets. 

One fun part of the Festival is the 'Fringe'. Here, students do funny shows in small places like cafes. Many tourists come to see new films, plays, and listen to famous musicians. This year, there are over five hundred shows with actors from more than forty countries. The tickets are not very expensive, and it is often easier to see your favorite star in Edinburgh than in London. 

So, come to Edinburgh next summer! But remember, it can be hard to find a room. It is a good idea to book your hotel now!'

ICE-FISHING

If you drive north from Toronto for three hours, you will find Lake Nipissing. In winter, the lake freezes, and many Canadian fishermen go there every weekend. They build small wooden houses on the ice and paint them in bright colors. Then they sit inside to catch fish that swim under the ice.

Bob Marvisch has come here for twenty-five years. He says, "You need light but warm clothes: two pairs of socks, gloves, several thin sweaters, and a snow suit on top. Catching fish is easy." 

First, you break the ice and make a small hole. Next, you take a fishing line and put some bread on it. Then you put the line through the hole and into the water. You pull the line up when the fish eat the bread. The fish are between ten and twenty centimeters long. Some people like to eat them, but when I catch three or four fish, I prefer chocolate or another snack! 

Today, I have caught twenty-five fish! It is a fun sport, and you can meet nice people here!

Madame Tussaud's

Madame Tussaud's is a famous museum in London. Many tourists visit this place. In the museum, people can see wax figures of famous people. 

Madame Tussaud was born in France in 1761. Her uncle was a doctor. He made wax figures of people and opened a museum in Paris. Marie helped her uncle with this work. 

In 1789, during the French Revolution, Marie went to prison. In prison, she had to make wax heads of famous people who were dead, like Queen Marie Antoinette. 

In 1795, Marie married Francois Tussaud. In 1802, she moved to London with her wax figures. She opened a museum there, and you can still see her figures today.

BICYCLES

A bicycle is a cheap and clean way to travel. The first bicycle was made about 150 years ago. At first, bicycles were very expensive. Only rich people could buy them. These early bicycles looked very different from today’s bicycles. Later, bicycles became cheaper, and many people bought them. People started riding bicycles to work and for fun. 

Today, many people use cars more than bicycles. Cars are faster, and you don’t get wet when it rains! But some people still like to ride bicycles to work. They say there are too many cars in town, and it is hard to find a place to park!

The Elephant Show by Daniel Allsop, age 14

Last summer, I went to Thailand with my family for a beach holiday. One day, we visited a park near our hotel. The park had beautiful flowers, but we wanted to see the elephant show. 

We went to a big area with seats on three sides. Three elephants came in with their trainers. They stood in front of a big white card. Each elephant got a paintbrush and started to paint on its card. The trainers gave them new brushes with paint and took the old ones away. The elephants painted pictures slowly. I was amazed! One picture was of a river, one was of a tree, and the last one was of flowers. When the trainers showed the paintings, everyone wanted to buy one.

We also gave the elephants bananas that we brought for lunch. Twenty years ago, elephants worked in the forest. Now, they do not work there anymore. The smartest elephants live in special places where people can watch them.

**Big Cats**

There are many kinds of cats. They are different in size and look. Tigers are the biggest cats. They can be 3.7 meters long from head to tail. Most cats do not like water, but tigers like to lie in water when it is hot!

Lions are the only cats that live in big family groups. Many lions work together to find food for the group. They usually live in flat, open places where they can see far and follow other animals easily.

All cats need good eyes to catch smaller animals for food. They also need to be fast and strong.

THE OSTRICH

The ostrich is the biggest bird in the world. An adult ostrich can weigh more than 90 kilos. Most wild ostriches live in southern Africa, but there are not many left. 

Ostriches have wings like all birds, but they cannot fly. They use their wings to help them turn when they run. Ostriches can run very fast, up to 90 kilometres an hour. This makes it hard for other animals to catch them. 

Baby ostriches are the same size as chickens. They take about 3 years to grow up. Ostriches eat plants and can live for many days without water.

Text: 'Victoria Jamieson is a snowboarder from Britain. She started snowboarding when she was 20 years old. Now she is 23 and has won many competitions. We talked to her at a snowboarding competition in Switzerland last week. We asked her why she started snowboarding. She said, "I have always liked sports, especially skiing. It was easy to start snowboarding. You can learn quickly and get good in a few months." 

We asked her if she practices a lot. She said, "In winter, I snowboard every day in the mountains from 8:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. I also run and ride my bike. I love it all! I enjoy the competitions and being in the mountains. It is very beautiful. But free-riding, which is when you do what you want, is the best for me." 

We asked her what is important when learning to snowboard. She said, "You can learn fast, but you need lessons. It is also important to have the right clothes so you don’t get wet. At first, you will fall down a lot!"'

**Mount Kilimanjaro**

Mount Kilimanjaro is the tallest mountain in Africa. Many people climb Kilimanjaro. They can be very young, like a seven-year-old boy, or very old, like an 87-year-old man. There are different paths to the top. The Marangu path is five kilometers long and is the easiest. It takes about five days to climb and many tourists like it.

Only half of the people who try to climb Kilimanjaro reach the top. This is often because the weather can change quickly. At the start, it can be hot and rainy. But at the top, there is ice and snow, and it can be very cold, below 20 degrees. Climbers need to bring sunglasses and warm clothes!

Otters

Not many people have seen an otter. Otters live near rivers. They make their homes from small pieces of wood. They usually come out at night. Otters are very good swimmers. They can swim faster than 10 kilometers an hour. They have thick brown fur that keeps them warm in the water. An otter can close its ears and nose. This helps them stay under water for a few minutes.

Twenty years ago, there were not many otters in Great Britain. The rivers were very dirty. Many fish and insects died, and otters could not find food. But now, the rivers are clean again, and there is lots of food for otters.

**Buildings**

People have always made buildings. We need houses to keep us warm and dry. We build stadiums to watch football games and concerts. We also have museums to keep beautiful things.

Many people work together to build a building. The architect decides how the building will look and draws pictures of it. Engineers make sure the building is strong and safe. Then, workers build it carefully.

The Sydney Opera House is a famous building. It has a beautiful roof. But the building looks nice from all sides, not just the top. The Olympic Stadium in Munich is also famous. It looks like a tent made of glass.

Text: "Indre, I have a problem and I need your help. Can you go shopping with me tomorrow? My grandmother is turning 80 next month and she is having a party on Saturday. I don’t have anything to wear. I have grown a lot, and my trousers are too short now! I want to buy new trousers and maybe some boots. I don’t have much money, but I think it will be enough. Do you want to meet in the morning or the afternoon? Please tell me. Sarika"

The Cerne Giant

Sherborne and Dorchester are two towns in the south of England. They are close to each other. Between these towns, there are many green hills and fields. On one hill, there is a big picture of a man. This man is called the Cerne Giant. The village next to him is called Cerne.

We do not know when the Cerne Giant was made, but it was a long time ago. You can walk from Cerne to see the picture. If you go on May 1st when the sun comes up, you will see many people from the village dancing around the man on the hill.

Gail Rollins

Gail Rollins is a great runner from Edinburgh. This summer, she wants to run 10,000 metres and maybe 5,000 metres at the European Championships. In the past, Gail often came second in big races. She always smiled, and people in her city love her for this.

In 2004, Gail ran her first half-marathon, which is a long race. She won and had the best time of the year for any British woman runner. 

Gail's husband, Mike Rollins, was also a runner when he was younger. He had to stop racing because he hurt his right leg. He can still run a little and sometimes trains with Gail. But it is not fun for Mike when Gail runs faster than him.

Gail trains hard. She runs long in the morning and fast in the afternoon. She takes a break from running on Sundays. Mike says, "I am with her all the time. Sometimes I ask, 'Are you sure you should eat that?' It is usually cake, but she can eat almost anything."

**Piano Players - When They Were Young**

**Ivan Petrov**  
Ivan was born on a farm in Russia. When he was twelve, he studied music in Poland. His first music teacher could not play the piano, but he taught Ivan and his sister songs from the opera. Ivan's mother taught him to play the piano when he was six years old. At ten, he wanted to write music, so he started his first song.

**Oleg Gagarin**  
Oleg was the youngest of five children. When he was four, his father, who liked to play the piano, taught him some Russian music. At six, Oleg began lessons with a piano teacher in his city. He won prizes for his piano playing. When he was fourteen, he went to a music college in Austria for two years. After that, he went back to Russia.

**Josef Heptmann**  
Josef's father was German, but he taught music in Poland, where Josef was born. The family moved to Germany when Josef was two years old. A year later, he started to play the piano. He had his first concert when he was six. At ten, he gave fifty-two concerts in two months in England! Josef loved music, but he also liked physics and languages. He is very busy now, but one day he wants to write his own music.

Bill Prince-Smith

Bill Prince-Smith was a farmer, a teacher, and a dentist. He became a writer of children's books when he was 60 years old. Now, after 13 years, he has written more than 80 books. Every day, he goes to his office to write. In the evening, he gives his work to his wife to read. "She tells me if she does not like something," says Bill. 

Bill's ten grandchildren do not live close, but they read his stories and tell him if they are good or bad. This helps Bill know what children like to read. He writes about life in his village and the farms around it. His favorite book is called The Sheepdog. It is about a farmer and his dog that helps him. 

"I have always liked animals," says Bill. "Dogs are very smart, and they learn quickly." Last year, they made a film of his book with real animals and actors. The people who made the film used new technology to make it look like the animals are talking. Bill was very happy with the film. "Sometimes, they change books for movies, but they did not change mine, and I love the film."

POSTCARDS

Today, people like to send postcards to friends and family. Postcards have pictures of beaches, mountains, or castles. You can write a message on the back. Many people send postcards when they are on holiday because they are cheap. The pictures on postcards are often better than their own photos.

The first postcard was sent a long time ago, at the end of the 1800s. It had a picture of a town by the sea. Later, postcards showed news events, like accidents or visits from important people. People liked these postcards because newspapers did not have pictures then.

Dinosaurs

No one has seen a dinosaur. The last dinosaur died about 60 million years ago. This was a long time before people were on Earth. We do not know why they all died. The closest living relatives of dinosaurs are birds.

Dinosaurs did not all look the same. There were more than 5000 kinds. Some were very small, but others were very big. The biggest dinosaurs were larger than any other land animals. 

For example, the Brontosaurus was twenty meters long and ate plants. The Tyrannosaurus Rex was not as big, but it was very strong. It had sharp teeth for eating meat and could run fast because it had long back legs.

Bears are big animals. They can be dangerous. An adult bear is very strong and can hurt a person. Bears can climb trees and run fast. But they do not see well. They find food with their noses.

There are seven types of bears. The biggest bear is the white polar bear. It can be almost three meters tall. There are two types of black bears. One lives in North America, and the other lives in South-East Asia. Not all black bears are black. They can be dark brown or reddish brown.

Many people love the black and white panda bear. Pandas come from China. There are not many pandas in the forest now because it is hard for them to find food.

CROCODILES

Crocodiles live in warm places like Africa, South America, and Northern Australia. They like to stay in slow water, but they can swim fast and run fast on land. You can see many crocodiles together in groups. They eat fish, birds, and small animals. Sometimes, they can eat big animals or even people.

There are more than ten kinds of crocodiles. All crocodiles have very sharp teeth. They can lose their teeth, but they grow new ones. Crocodiles are usually about 3.5 meters long, but some are bigger. They can live a long time. The oldest crocodile in a zoo was 66 years old.

A HISTORY OF AIR TRAVEL

In 1783, two French brothers made the first balloon to take people into the sky. One hundred and twenty years later, in 1903, the Wright brothers made the first plane with an engine. They flew it in the United States. In 1918, the US Post Office started the first airmail service.

Aeroplanes changed a lot in the next thirty years. In the 1950s, aeroplanes became much faster because they had jet engines. In 1976, Concorde was made in the UK and France. It is the fastest passenger plane in the world. It can fly at 2500 kilometres an hour, so the trip from London to New York takes only four hours.

Today, millions of people travel by aeroplane. It is hard to imagine a world without them.

The Globe Theatre

Visiting the theatre in London 400 years ago was very different. The building was round and had no roof. If it rained, people got cold and wet. The queen liked to go to the Globe Theatre by the River Thames to see plays by William Shakespeare. All the actors were men. Visitors ate food, talked to friends, and walked around during the show. Some people even threw things at the actors!

Today, you can still visit the Globe Theatre. A new theatre is in the same place by the river. You can watch a Shakespeare play or learn about life in the 1600s.

Dear Jeff,

This week, we are in Sydney, but next week we will go to the Great Barrier Reef. The water is warm, and I love swimming there. The fish are many colors: red, yellow, and purple! Australia is very beautiful. We do not want to go home! 

See you at the end of September. 

Sue
